linux.name: maximumOnDemandScanThreads
linux.description: Specify the maximum number of number of threads used to perform the on demand scan.

linux.name: passiveMode
linux.description: Whether the antivirus engine runs in passive mode or not.

linux.name: BlockLinuxEnrollment
linux.description: Specifies whether to block Linux enrollments

linux.name: cloudBlockLevel
linux.description: Determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint is in blocking and scanning suspicious files.

linux.name: enforcementLevel
linux.description: Specifies the enforcement preference of antivirus engine. Real-time: Real-time protection (scan files as they're modified) is enabled. On-demand: Files are scanned only on demand and real-time protection is turned off. Passive: Runs the antivirus engine in passive mode.

linux.name: behaviorMonitoring
linux.description: Whether the antivirus engine runs behavior monitoring and blocking or not.

linux.name: scanResultsRetentionDays
linux.description: Specify the number of days that results are retained in the scan history on the device. Old scan results are removed from the history. Old quarantined files that are also removed from the disk.

linux.name: exclusions_item_name
linux.description: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards supported

linux.name: exclusions_item_path
linux.description: Path to exclude, wildcards are NOT supported

linux.name: CustomConfigExecutionRetries
linux.description: Specifies how many times to retry script execution on failure.

linux.name: tags_item_value
linux.description: Only one value per tag type can be set. Type of tags are unique, and should not be repeated in the same configuration profile.

linux.name: disallowedThreatActions
linux.description: Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected. The actions included in this list are not displayed in the user interface.

linux.name: exclusions_item_name
linux.description: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards NOT supported

linux.name: exclusions
linux.description: Global exclusions apply to both Antivirus and Endpoint detection and response to exclude at a much lower level closer to sensors. Usage: Tackling performance issues. Risk: Significantly risks protection

linux.name: unmonitoredFilesystems
linux.description: List of filesystems (identified by their name) to be unmonitored/excluded from Real Time Protection(RTP).

linux.name: threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy
linux.description: Specify the merge policy for threat type settings. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined settings (merge) or only administrator-defined settings (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own settings for different threat types.

linux.name: exclusions_item_path
linux.description: Path to exclude, wildcards are supported

linux.name: exclusionsMergePolicy
linux.description: Specify the merge policy for exclusions. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined exclusions (merge) or only administrator-defined exclusions (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own exclusions.

linux.name: threatTypeSettings
linux.description: The threatTypeSettings preference in the antivirus engine is used to control how certain threat types are handled by the product.

linux.name: exclusions_item_isDirectory
linux.description: Directory if selected, or file if not selected

linux.name: scanHistoryMaximumItems
linux.description: Specify the maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history. Entries include all on-demand scans performed in the past and all antivirus detections.

linux.name: exclusions
linux.description: Entities that have been excluded from the scan. Exclusions can be specified by full paths, extensions, or file names.

linux.name: enableFileHashComputation
linux.description: Whether the antivirus engine computes hashes for the files it scans or not.

linux.name: enabled
linux.description: Provides increased, faster protection with access to the latest protection data in the cloud. Works best with automatic sample submission turned on
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences

linux.name: automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled
linux.description: Determines whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically:
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences

linux.name: tags_item_key
linux.description: Specify a tag name and its value. The GROUP tag, tags the device with the specified value. The tag is reflected in the portal under the device page and can be used for filtering and grouping devices.

linux.name: allowedThreats
linux.description: List of threats (identified by their name) that are not blocked by the product and are instead allowed to run.

linux.name: threatTypeSettings_item_key
linux.description: Type of the threat for which the behavior is configured.

linux.name: scanArchives
linux.description: Specifies whether to scan archives during on-demand antivirus scans.

linux.name: automaticSampleSubmissionConsent
linux.description: Sends sample files to Microsoft to help protect device users and your organization from potential threats
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences

linux.name: CustomConfig_Script
linux.description: Select the file containing the script to execute.

linux.name: scanAfterDefinitionUpdate
linux.description: Specifies whether to start a process scan after new security intelligence updates are downloaded on the device.

linux.name: CustomConfigExecutionContext
linux.description: Specifies in which context to execute the script.

linux.name: CustomConfigExecutionFrequency
linux.description: Specifies how frequently to execute the script.

linux.name: nonExecMountPolicy
linux.description: Specifies the behavior of RTP on mount point marked as nonexec.

linux.name: enableRealTimeProtection
linux.description: Locates and stops malware from installing or running on your device. You can turn off this setting for a short time before it turns back on automatically.

linux.name: threatTypeSettings_item_value
linux.description: Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified in the preceding section.

linux.name: diagnosticLevel
linux.description: We encourage you to share your diagnostic and usage data with us to help improve Microsoft products and services.
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences

linux.name: exclusions_item_isDirectory
linux.description: Directory if selected, or file if not selected

linux.name: enforcementLevel
linux.description: Specifies if network protection is disabled, in audit mode, or enforced
